poem:
**Fuel of Conscience**

These trees, silent witnesses,  
speak not of renewables,  
but of a paradise felled,  
while engines hum a dirge  
for forests vanished.  
In the heart of combustion,  
truth flickers as betrayal—  
light from wood's flesh,  
transforming green promises  
into gray, smoky veil.  
Winds whisper of the past:  
a world once verdant, lost.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK power company Drax investigated over source of ‘renewable’ fuel The power generator Drax has revealed it is under investigation by the City watchdog over “historical statements” made about the sourcing of wood pellets for its biomass power station. The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) confirmed the investigation on Thursday, which will cover a period of more than two years between January 2022 to March 2024, and examine whether the company complied with disclosure and transparency". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
